reasons_to_visit.details: May offers arguably Stockholm's most pleasant weather: increasingly sunny, mild temperatures (average highs ~16°C/61°F), perfect for exploring outdoors as the city bursts into green.
Experience Stockholm adorned with spring flowers. See tulips in Kungsträdgården and potentially the tail end of the cherry blossoms early in the month. Parks are lush and inviting.
Outdoor seating ('uteserveringar') becomes widespread. Enjoy coffee, drinks, or meals outdoors, soaking up the returning warmth and vibrant city life.
While tourism picks up significantly, May generally sees fewer crowds and potentially better prices than the peak months of June, July, and August.
Ferry services to the archipelago increase, making it easier and more pleasant to take day trips to nearby islands as services and amenities reopen.
Stockholm's beloved seaside amusement park on Djurgården usually opens for the season in late April/early May, offering rides and entertainment.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: While often pleasant, May can still bring cooler days, wind, and rain showers. Packing layers is essential.
May marks a definite shift towards high season. Expect more noticeable crowds and rising prices for flights and accommodation compared to early spring.
May 1st is a major public holiday. Expect widespread closures (shops, Systembolaget, banks) and potentially large demonstrations/marches affecting city center access and transport.
Ascension Day (Kristi Himmelsfärdsdag), a public holiday, often falls in May (date varies). This creates a long weekend, increasing domestic travel and potentially impacting availability/prices.
Spring blooms, especially birch trees, mean high pollen counts, significantly affecting allergy sufferers.

weather.precipitation: Moderate chance of rain showers, but significantly more sunshine and longer days than April. Can still be cool, especially evenings.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, sweaters, a medium-weight jacket (waterproof useful), comfortable walking shoes. Sunglasses and potentially allergy medication.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate, noticeably busier than April. Very busy around May 1st and potentially Walpurgis Night hangover (April 30th).
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder/High season prices emerging. Book ahead, especially around May 1st.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Vibrant spring awakening. City is greening up. Lively feel, especially when sunny. Potential disruption/closures on May 1st.

events_holidays.name: Walpurgis Night (Valborgsmässoafton) - Evening Before
events_holidays.description: Eve of May 1st. Celebrated with bonfires, singing, and student festivities. Main Stockholm celebration usually at Skansen. Riddarholmen sometimes has events.
events_holidays.notes: Popular event, especially at Skansen (expect crowds). May impact city atmosphere leading into May 1st.

events_holidays.name: May Day / Labor Day (Första maj)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Characterized by political demonstrations and marches by labor unions, primarily in the city center.
events_holidays.notes: Widespread closures (shops, Systembolaget, banks). Expect traffic/transport disruptions in central areas due to marches. Check opening status for museums/sites.

events_holidays.name: Cherry Blossom Peak (Potential End)
events_holidays.description: The spectacular pink cherry blossoms in Kungsträdgården typically peak late April/early May. You might catch the end of the bloom.
events_holidays.notes: Very popular photo spot when in bloom.

unique_experiences.description: If timing is right (early May), witness the beautiful pink cherry blossoms. Even without peak bloom, the park is pleasant.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check bloom status online ('körsbärsblomning Kungsträdgården'). Can get very crowded during peak bloom.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the historic buildings, see Nordic animals, and enjoy spring activities. Check for any specific May Day or spring programs.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Good activity for May 1st if open (check hours). Allow several hours.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the Swedish coffee and cake tradition at one of the many outdoor seating areas opening up.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Choose a sunny spot. Great for people-watching.

unique_experiences.description: Walk or cycle around the green 'museum island', home to Vasa Museum, Skansen, ABBA Museum, Nordic Museum, Rosendals Trädgård (garden), and more.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Rent bikes near the bridge or use public transport (tram/bus/ferry). Very pleasant in spring.

weather.precipitation: Generally pleasant, sunny, and warmer spring weather. Reduced chance of rain. Long daylight hours.
weather.general_tips: Focus on lighter layers, but keep a jacket/sweater for evenings. Sun protection increasingly important.

tourism_level.crowds: High season approaching. Busy, especially on weekends and if Ascension Day falls here.
tourism_level.pricing: High season prices likely in effect for most accommodations/flights.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Beautiful late spring / early summer feel. Ideal for outdoor activities and exploring the city before peak summer heat/crowds.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Kristi Himmelsfärdsdag)
events_holidays.date: Varies (Thursday, 40 days after Easter - often May)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Creates a long weekend ('klämdag' - bridge day on Friday is common).
events_holidays.notes: Check date for the year. Expect closures (shops, banks). Increased domestic travel; book accommodation/transport ahead if traveling this weekend.

events_holidays.name: Gröna Lund Amusement Park Open
events_holidays.date: Usually daily or weekends by late May
events_holidays.description: Enjoy rides, games, and potentially concerts at Stockholm's amusement park.
events_holidays.notes: Check official website for opening hours and concert schedule.

events_holidays.name: Stockholm Marathon (Potential - Check Dates)
events_holidays.description: Major international marathon event through central Stockholm.
events_holidays.notes: Significant road closures and crowds along the route if occurring. Check date for the year.

unique_experiences.description: Take a ferry further into the archipelago as more routes and island services become available. Enjoy island walks, cafes, and scenery.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check Waxholmsbolaget/Strömma timetables. Book popular routes/restaurants ahead, especially weekends/Ascension weekend.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the beautiful biodynamic garden with orchards, flower beds, greenhouses, a shop, and a popular café serving organic food and pastries.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Lovely spot for lunch or fika in a green setting. Accessible by walking/biking on Djurgården or bus.

unique_experiences.where: Various routes (e.g., Djurgården, Skeppsholmen, Södermalm waterfront)
unique_experiences.description: Rent a bike and explore Stockholm's bike-friendly paths in pleasant spring weather.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Numerous rental options available. Be mindful of dedicated bike lanes.

unique_experiences.activity: Enjoy Evening Drinks by the Water
unique_experiences.description: Take advantage of the long, mild evenings to have drinks or dinner with views over the water.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Popular spots can get busy. Some locations offer stunning sunset views.
